26.00.text:

29.96.text:
in women, global macro trends in business
solutions, strategic corporate sustainability.

Earl F Cheit Outstanding Teaching Award and

45.34.text:

1,000 companies and organizations all over

54.31.text:
the world in developing, integrating, and

64.34.text: her PhD from the University of Michigan.

116.05.text:

130.39.text:

139.49.text: on the board, or one or more.

141.49.text:

as of yet, only 16.1% of Fortune 500 companies

149.85.text: have even one woman on the board.

152.77.text:
What we found was that there was a correlation
between companies who had one or more women

157.67.text:
on the board and improved environmental performance
of the company, so higher investment in renewable

164.22.text:
energy, reduction of packaging, reduction
of water usage.

169.29.text:
Things that really improved both the financial
performance of the firm, because if you reduce

173.79.text:

The highest correlation that we found was
with environmental performance of the firm.

187.35.text:

performance of the firm.

from less healthy products, more sugar laden

683.54.text: and start with a business case.
